alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 5:39PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...Periods of Heavy rain for the Seward area Thursday... A strong low pressure system will bring in an atmospheric river of moisture from the tropical Pacific. This system will bring periods of moderate to heavy rain increasing in intensity tonight and tomorrow morning for the Seward area. Expect 2 to 3 inches of rain through Thursday night with up to 5 inches in the surrounding mountains near Seward. Additional light rain will continue off and on through Saturday with up to a half inch of additional rainfall. The rain will produce rises to the rivers and streams near Seward These area rivers may approach bankfull conditions on Thursday and continuing through Saturday. Additionally, a glacial dammed lake on Bear Glacier in the Fjords National Park near Seward continues to releases water. This may wash some glacial ice chunks from the Bear Glacier Lagoon into Resurrection Bay. This ice is a hazard to boaters. Anyone boating in Resurrection Bay should be alert to avoid running into these ice chunks.
